|Title=Knowing whether diplopia is monocular or binocular

Diplopia is double vision of a single object.

Binocular diplopia is present when both eyes are open and disappears when either eye is occluded.

Monocular diplopia persists when the healthy eye is occluded and disappears when the affected eye is occluded.

question.question: What is the characteristic of monocular diplopia?
question.option_a: It disappears when either eye is occluded
question.option_b: It persists when the healthy eye is occluded
question.option_c: It is present when both eyes are open
question.option_d: It is a type of vision loss that occurs in both eyes
